result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J. KLEIN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment or school or participate in a work search if unemployed.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Complete any counseling the DOC suggests.  

Submit DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody on WRIT.
This matter is reset to 02-05-16 at 8:30 a.m.
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for his plea/sentencing hearing on 02-04-16 at 3:00 p.m. 
Copy filed.
Plea/Sentencing hearing reset to 12-15-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 3.
Plea date at 02-04-2016 03:00 pm

The Court hereby orders that the no contact order between the defendant and Jessica Peterson is modified to a no assaultive contact provision as long as the defendant remains incarcerated in the Manitowoc County Jail or in a facility controlled by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
Copy to jail.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-28-15 at 9:30 a.m.  Plea date is set for 02-04-16 at 3:00 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-23-15 at 10:00 a.m.   
Minutes.
Anthony Lambrecht, Public Defender.
RE:  Jessica Peterson, on 08-16-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of strangulation/suffocation and battery-dvo.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-14-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers City Police Department  for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and have no contact with Jessica Peterson or any premises she occupies.   Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold.
Minutes.
